The crystal structure of each compound was characterized by its X-ray diffraction (XRD) pattern using the Rietveld method
19 with the FullProf program.
20 From the ICSD database, the equivalent isotropic displacement parameters and atomic coordinates were used. Using a pseudo-Voigt function with an asymmetry correction at low angles, the shape of the peak was fitted. The obtained patterns from Rietveld refinement of the XRD data are presented in Figure 1 . The final values of the equivalent isotropic displacement parameters and atomic coordinates are given in Table S1 (and Tables S3 and S5). The selected bond distances are presented in Table S2 (and Tables S4 and S6). Figure 2 shows the change in lattice volume before and after the nitridation of each Li 2MSiO 4 compound.
